bugs.title: CVE-2014-2329 CVE-2014-2330 CVE-2014-2331 CVE-2014-2332 check-mk: multiple flaws fixed in versions 1.2.2p3 and 1.2.3i5

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2014-2329 CVE-2014-2330 CVE-2014-2331 CVE-2014-2332 check-mk: multiple flaws fixed in versions 1.2.2p3 and 1.2.3i5

long_desc.thetext:
Deutsche Telekom CERT Advisory DTC-A-20140324-002 notes a number of security flaws have been fixed in check-mk (a Nagios plug-in) versions 1.2.2p3 and 1.2.3i5:

http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/125850/DTC-A-20140324-002.txt

These include cross-site scripting, cross-site request forgery, and arbitrary command execution flaws.

Created check-mk tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1080304]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1080305]
I'm working on packaging the 1.2.2p3. An update will be pushed today.
check-mk-1.2.4p2-1.fc19 has been pushed to the Fedora 19 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
check-mk-1.2.4p2-1.fc20 has been pushed to the Fedora 20 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
check-mk-1.2.4p2-1.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
check-mk-1.2.4p2-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

when all affected versions are fixed.
